answer_html: The set Y is the union of all of the sets S\(\alpha\); that is, Y is the set of all y such that there exists an \(\alpha\) \(\in\) I such that y \(\in\) S\(\alpha\).
answer_latex:
The set \emph{Y} is the \emph{union} of all of the sets
\emph{S}\textsubscript{$\alpha$}; that is, \emph{Y} is the set of all \emph{y}
such that there exists an $\alpha$ $\in$ \emph{I} such that \emph{y} $\in$
\emph{S}\textsubscript{$\alpha$}.
hints_html: Can you recall what A\(\cap\)B and A\(\cup\)B are?
hints_latex: Can you recall what \emph{A}$\cap$\emph{B} and \emph{A}$\cup$\emph{B} are?
hints_raw: Can you recall what ''A''&cap;''B'' and ''A''&cup;''B'' are?
question: 1 (b)
sols_html:
The set X is the intersection of all of the sets S\(\alpha\); that is, X is the set of all x such that, for all \(\alpha\) \(\in\) I we have x \(\in\) S\(\alpha\).

The set Y is the union of all of the sets S\(\alpha\); that is, Y is the set of all y such that there exists an \(\alpha\) \(\in\) I such that y \(\in\) S\(\alpha\).
sols_latex:
The set \emph{X} is the \emph{intersection} of all of the sets
\emph{S}\textsubscript{$\alpha$}; that is, \emph{X} is the set of all \emph{x}
such that, for all $\alpha$ $\in$ \emph{I} we have \emph{x} $\in$
\emph{S}\textsubscript{$\alpha$}.

The set \emph{Y} is the \emph{union} of all of the sets
\emph{S}\textsubscript{$\alpha$}; that is, \emph{Y} is the set of all \emph{y}
such that there exists an $\alpha$ $\in$ \emph{I} such that \emph{y} $\in$
\emph{S}\textsubscript{$\alpha$}.
sols_raw:
The set ''X'' is the ''intersection'' of all of the sets ''S''<sub>&alpha;</sub>; that is, ''X'' is the set of all ''x'' such that, for all &alpha; &isin; ''I'' we have ''x'' &isin; ''S''<sub>&alpha;</sub>.

The set ''Y'' is the ''union'' of all of the sets ''S''<sub>&alpha;</sub>; that is, ''Y'' is the set of all ''y'' such that there exists an &alpha; &isin; ''I'' such that ''y'' &isin; ''S''<sub>&alpha;</sub>.
statement_html:
Define the sets

\[\begin{aligned} X = \bigcap_{\alpha \in I} S_\alpha\end{aligned}\]

and

\[\begin{aligned} Y = \bigcup_{\alpha \in I} S_\alpha\end{aligned}\]
statement_raw:
Define the sets

:<math> X = \bigcap_{\alpha \in I} S_\alpha</math>

and

:<math> Y = \bigcup_{\alpha \in I} S_\alpha</math>
